answeringCalls: Let unknown calls go to voicemail
Hang up if pressured or threatened
protectingYourself: Register on National Do Not Call Registry
Never give personal information over phone
reportingScams: Contact your bank if financial information was shared
Place fraud alert with credit bureaus

commonScams.imposterScams: Scammers posing as government officials, utility companies, or tech support
commonScams.romanceScams: Online scams involving individuals claiming romantic interest
commonScams.phishingScams: Emails or text messages that attempt to steal personal information
commonScams.robocalls: Automated phone calls with pre-recorded messages often promoting scams

areaSpecificScams.fakeApartmentListings: Scammers advertising non-existent apartments for rent
areaSpecificScams.extendedCarWarranties: Fraudulent offers for extended car warranties
areaSpecificScams.studentLoanScams: Calls or emails pretending to offer student loan forgiveness or debt relief

scamPatterns.description: Scammers call claiming to be from a utility company and demand immediate payment for overdue bills, often threatening to disconnect service.
Scammers contact victims through unsolicited calls or pop-ups, claiming to offer technical support for computer problems and requesting remote access or payment for bogus services.
Scammers impersonate Medicare representatives and attempt to obtain personal information or Medicare numbers to commit fraud.
Scammers call elderly victims claiming to be a grandchild in an emergency, requesting money to be wired.
Victims receive unwanted automated phone calls, often from spoofed numbers that appear local, promoting scams or phishing attempts.

localScams.description: Scammers spoofing local caller ID to appear as legitimate organizations, such as banks or utility companies, and attempting to obtain sensitive information or payments.
Automated calls offering free vacations, low-interest loans, or other incentives to trick recipients into providing personal or financial information.
Phishing messages claiming to be from delivery services or government agencies, requesting payment or personal details.
Fake accounts or sponsored posts impersonating businesses or individuals to solicit funds or promote fraudulent products.
Organizations posing as legitimate charities to exploit the generosity of locals, often during natural disasters or holidays.

knownScamPatterns.description: Scammers pretending to be from IRS, Social Security, or local authorities
indicators: Requesting gift cards or wire transfers

knownScamPatterns.description: Automated calls about extended car warranties
Fake technical support calls claiming computer problems
